images.caption: A unicellular alga with a well-visible nucleus (in the centre) and green chloroplasts with globular pyrenoids. There are vacuoles at both ends of the cell, containing small gypsum crystals which show Brownian motion. Photo: Prof. Aloisie Poulíčková
Xanthidium is a unicellular desmid. The cell is composed of two halves (semicells). Photo: Prof. Aloisie Poulíčková
